title: De Corpore; Or, Elements of Philosophy, The First Section, Concerning Body
sourceDesc: [De Corpore] was first published in Latin in 1655, and then published in English in 1656, as [The Elements of Philosophy, The First Section, Concerning Body]. Our copytext is this first English edition. As the English title indicates, it was apparently conceived as the first part of a larger work. Part 2, [De Homine], was published in Latin in 1658, but never appeared in English translation (and is therefore not included on this site). Part 3, [De Cive], was in fact the first part Hobbes wrote, and was published in Latin in 1642. It was also the first to appear in translation, published in 1651 as [Philosophicall Rudiments Concerning Government and Society](https://englishphilosophy.org/texts/hobbes/civ).
author: Thomas Hobbes
